TopicTitle: Modding Mondays: A Sandstorm on Duna

Articles.Content:
<p><img alt="image" src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/f877983c4f5dc185bb3b4a0e8611b711/tumblr_inline_n3brsdqCLQ1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><a href="http://imgur.com/TTFZ1NJ"><img src="http://i.imgur.com/TTFZ1NJ.jpg" title="Hosted by imgur.com"/></a></p>

<p>Just as the game advances, so do the crazy thing the Modder community is capable of. Perhaps youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve seen <strong>rbray89Ã¢â‚¬â„¢</strong>s <a href="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55905-0-23-5-7-1-EnvironmentalVisualEnhancements-NEW%21-VolumetricClouds%21"><strong>Environmental Visual Enhancements</strong></a> before, giving Kerbin city lights and an interesting solution for clouds, but this new version takes it to a new planet, literally.</p>

Edited April 7, 2014 by KasperVld
Wow! I want someone to fly a spaceplane through Eve's clouds, or even Jool's clouds!
Awesome mod, congrats rbray89!
This is the best visual mod out there (Sorry TextureReplacer, you're a really close second). I have a hard time looking at Kerbin without it.

This is the best visual mod out there (Sorry TextureReplacer, you're a really close second). I have a hard time looking at Kerbin without it.

I can't look at Kerbin without it.

Awesome mod, congrats rbray89!

Yes, rbray made volumetrics (itself a considerable feat and serious props to him - my game has never looked so beautiful), but it was RuBisCO who came up with the idea of low level volumetrics acting as sandstorms

Besides, I like to think my post on reddit about this exact thing inspired this, even if it didn't.
Yeah this mod is sweet. The volumetric clouds are amazing, it's almost like a different thickness of clouds each time, so it sort of makes your launches unique.
Well, I'll be getting that mod.
I've been considering getting that mod for a while now. This convinced me.

The release came a bit late for my Duna mission - I guess I have to go again?!

Forgot to take a look at Ike anyway.

This is the best visual mod out there (Sorry TextureReplacer, you're a really close second). I have a hard time looking at Kerbin without it.

One I installed this, I don't think I can go back. Kerbin looks SO MUCH BETTER with volumetric clouds to launch through.
As Scott Manley already said, this needs to be in stock KSP. Not necessarely now, but it needs to happen (maybe with an option to turn the clouds off, if your PC has issues with the simulation)

Wow! I want someone to fly a spaceplane through Eve's clouds, or even Jool's clouds!
Give Scott Manley a week and i bet he will since he's currently at eve and i believe he has a mission to jool in the works.
Too bad my krappy laptop can manage 15-20 FPS on vanilla KSP with ultra butchered settings.
a must have since first release

Too bad my krappy laptop can manage 15-20 FPS on vanilla KSP with ultra butchered settings.

This dosen't affect performance.

This dosen't affect performance.

It uses RAM, for some of us that means it effects performance quit profoundly .
The author's other plugin can help with that part
Is it an FPS boost mod?
I'm very honored! I just hope I can keep raising the bar

This is my number one mod. Number two is Texture Management.

These are the only two mods that are immune to culling when I run into memory issues and need to cut. Everything else can go but my clouds. The improvement to the games appearance is amazing. And Rbray89 Gets both the two top slots. Those two mods give me a such a beautiful Kerbin, I can't go back to stock....

This is my number one mod. Number two is Texture Management.

These are the only two mods that are immune to culling when I run into memory issues and need to cut. Everything else can go but my clouds. The improvement to the games appearance is amazing. And Rbray89 Gets both the two top slots. Those two mods give me a such a beautiful Kerbin, I can't go back to stock....

Haha, it is kinda funny actually. Initially, lots of people liked the clouds, but couldn't run due to memory issues, so I decided to do something about that. Had no idea it would take off so much.

"My mod is so awesome, I had to make another mod to be able to run it", basically

'Grats again on the spotlight!
every time I launch trough the new clouds I got this WOAH!-feeling.
